definition: shoulder to shoulder/abreast/side by side
shoulder/to shoulder (responsibilities etc)
and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
to combine/to amalgamate
variant of 並|并[bing4]
shoulder/to shoulder (responsibilities etc)

sentences.english: Colleen would urge her sister to join her in bed. As they sat up in bed side by side, holding hands, Colleen and her sister would “just talk.”
sentences.chinese: 当她们姐妹在床上肩并肩手挽手地坐着她们都会聊天。

sentences.english: The first set is side by side.
sentences.chinese: 第一组是肩并肩的一对圆。

sentences.english: I went through alcoholism treatment with Rielly.
sentences.chinese: 我和里利一起，肩并肩，终于挺过了酗酒治疗。

sentences.english: We jammed together, shoulder-to-shoulder, in the narrow confines.
sentences.chinese: 在有限的空间里，我们紧紧挤在一起，肩并肩。

sentences.english: Prudence opened a window and we leaned on our elbows side by side on the balcony.
sentences.chinese: 普律当丝打开一扇窗子，我们肩并肩地倚在阳台上。

sentences.english: Shoulder to shoulder, hand in hand, and complete your life journey.
sentences.chinese: 肩并肩，手挽手，共同走完这段人生路。

sentences.english: The students stood side by side for the class photo.
sentences.chinese: 学生们肩并肩地站好全班照相。

sentences.english: Remember we had, shoulder to shoulder together, that busy lane that has.
sentences.chinese: 还记得我们曾经，肩并肩一起走过，那段繁华巷口。

sentences.english: They embraced and walked away side by side.
sentences.chinese: 他们拥抱着，肩并肩离开了。

sentences.english: Side by side, the two teenagers traversed the mysteries of the silent woods.
sentences.chinese: 两位青年肩并肩地横穿过寂寥无声的神秘森林。
部队肩并肩地齐步前进。

sentences.english: We sat side by side, then went to the foyer.
sentences.chinese: 我们肩并肩地坐着，然后去了休息室。

definition: alongside/shoulder to shoulder/side by side/abreast
to join hands/hand in hand
hand in hand
hand in hand and shoulder to shoulder
side by side/abreast
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
arms around each other's shoulders (idiom)
talking and laughing/to jest/cheerful and lively
lit. in the same boat under wind and rain (idiom); fig. to stick together in hard times
head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
to hold hands
to go with sb/to form companionships
to talk cheerfully and wittily/to joke together
hand in hand/to join hands/to collaborate
to band together/to gang up/to stick together
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
